com.tversity.airflinger.sdk.android
Class AirFlinger

java.lang.Object
  com.tversity.airflinger.sdk.android.AirFlinger

public class AirFlinger
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the entry point to the AirFlinger SDK.

With the getInstance() method you get the singleton object of this class. With this object you initialize and terminate the SDK and get access to available devices.

You must call init() before starting to use AirFlinger.
terminate() should be called during shutdown for cleanup.

init

public void init(Activity activity,
                 int notificationIcon,
                 int listenerPort,
                 Types.IEventCallback eventCallback,
                 int eventMask,
                 Types.ILogCallback logCallback)
          throws Types.AlreadyInitializedException
Use this method first before trying to access any of AirFlinger's functionality.

Parameters:
activity - The activity that hosts AirFlinger
listenerPort - The port the SDK uses to serve media files. Must be unique.
notificationIcon - this is the icon that will be used for the service manager - can be R.drawable.app
eventCallback - Callback to receive notifications
eventMask - Bitwise combination of EVENT_LISTEN_* that specifies to which SDK events to listen
logCallback - Optional callback to receive all SDK's log messages
Throws:
Types.AlreadyInitializedException

Parameters:
logCallback - Callback to receive all SDK's log messages
Throws:
Types.ServiceDisconnectedException

searchDevices

public void searchDevices()
                   throws Types.ServiceDisconnectedException
Searches for devices on the network.

Note: New devices found by this command, will be reported through the AirFlinger events callback passed in the init() method.

Throws:
Types.ServiceDisconnectedException

getCurrentDevices

public Device[] getCurrentDevices()
Gets a list of all discovered devices.

This function returns a snapshot of the known devices that were discovered at the time of the call.

Note: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Returns:
An array of all the devices that AirFlinger detected.

getCurrentDevices

public Device[] getCurrentDevices(Types.DeviceType deviceType)
Gets a list of all discovered devices of the specified type.

This function returns a snapshot of the known devices of the specified type that were discovered at the time of the call.

Note: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Parameters:
deviceType - Type of the devices to receive
Returns:
An array of all the devices of the specified type that AirFlinger detected.

getCurrentPlayers

public Player[] getCurrentPlayers()
Gets a list of all discovered player devices.

This is a convenience method which is the same as calling getCurrentDevices(DeviceType.PLAYER) with the returned list already casted to Player.

Note: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Returns:
An array of all the devices of the specified type that AirFlinger detected.

getCurrentServers

public Server[] getCurrentServers()
Gets a list of all discovered server devices.

This is a convenience method which is the same as calling getCurrentDevices(DeviceType.SERVER) with the returned list already casted to Server.

Note 1: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Note 2: IEventCallback.OnServerStatusChange() (provided during init()) callback should be used to monitor changes to this list.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Returns:
An array of all the servers that AirFlinger detected.
See Also:
IEventCallback.OnServerStatusChange(), init()

selectResourceForPlay

public Resource selectResourceForPlay(MediaItem item,
                                      Player player)
Use this method to check with the sdk which resource it would select for playing. A media item may have more than one resource. This method returns the resource that the sdk will select for playing on a player. Use this method when you need to access this resource information. When a player is provided, the selected resource will be the one most fitting to the player's capabilities. If a player is not provided, the best resource to represent this media item on the local device will be selected.

Parameters:
item - The media item
player - The player on which the media item is intended to be played. Optional.
Returns:
The selected resource, or nil.
